summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report documenting an interview conducted on August 16, 2019, with an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The inmate provides observations about the night of August 9-10, 2019, leading up to Jeffrey Epstein being found unresponsive in his cell. The report details the inmate's location, the guards on duty, and his last sighting of Epstein.

persons.name: Margaret Girard
persons.context: FBI Special Agent who conducted the interview of the inmate at the MCC on August 16, 2019, and drafted the report.

persons.name: Jose Charriez
persons.context: FBI Special Agent present during the interview of the inmate at the MCC on August 16, 2019.

persons.name: Davie Rodriguez
persons.context: Task Force Officer present during the interview of the inmate at the MCC on August 16, 2019.

persons.name: Omar Daza
persons.context: Office of the Inspector General Investigator present during the interview of the inmate at the MCC on August 16, 2019.

persons.name: Tijuana Doctor
persons.context: Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center present during the interview of the inmate on August 16, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell (cell #215, L-tier, Special Housing Unit) on the morning of August 10, 2019. The interviewee describes seeing him on a stretcher.

connections.description: Special Agent Girard was part of the team investigating the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
Special Agent Charriez was part of the team investigating the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
As an MCC Lieutenant, Doctor was part of the correctional staff responsible for the facility where Epstein was held.

events.title: Epstein's Last Night in Cell
events.description: The inmate witness reports being in L-tier, cell #215, Special Housing Unit, on the night of August 9, 2019. He recalls food being brought to Epstein's cell and that Epstein's roommate was not present that night.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: On the morning of August 10, 2019, the inmate witness recalls waking up around 6am and hearing a male voice possibly saying 'breathe.' He last saw Jeffrey Epstein on a stretcher being taken out of his cell, with his eyes closed.

events.title: FBI Interview of Inmate Witness
events.description: FBI Special Agents and other investigators interviewed an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding his observations on the nights of August 9 and 10, 2019, related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
L-tier, Special Housing Unit, cell #215 (within MCC)
keyFacts: An inmate witness was interviewed on August 16, 2019, about the nights leading to Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The witness was housed in L-tier, cell #215, in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of the MCC at the time.
The witness reported that on the night of August 9, Epstein's cellmate was not present, and he did not recall seeing anyone enter or leave Epstein's cell after food was delivered.
On the morning of August 10, the witness reported hearing a male voice possibly saying 'breathe' and later saw Epstein on a stretcher with his eyes closed being removed from his cell.
The document notes the presence of a 'small and chubby' female guard and a black male guard with a medium build working in the SHU that night, but their names are not provided.
